org.ensor.robots.differentialdrive

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ensor.robots.differentialdrive.Model

  • public class Model
extends Object
    This class implements an elementary model for differential steering based on this paper. All units of length are presumed to be in terms of meters and angle measures are in terms of radians.
    Author:
    jona

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Model.SpeedAndTurnRate
      This class represents the speed of a differential drive assembly and the rate of turn.
      static class  Model.WheelVelocities
      This class represents the state of movement of a differential drive assembly by representing the velocities of each of the two wheels.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Model(double aWheelDistance)
      This instantiates the simple differential drive model with the distance between the two wheels given in meters.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Model.SpeedAndTurnRate calculateBearing(double aLeftVelocity, double aRightVelocity)
      This method calculates the speed and turn rate from the given wheel velocities.
      Model.SpeedAndTurnRate calculateBearing(Model.WheelVelocities aWheelVelocities)
      This method calculates the speed and turn rate from the given wheel velocities.
      Model.WheelVelocities calculateWheelVelocities(double aVelocity, double aRadiansPerSecond)
      This method calculates the speed of each of the wheels given the total velocity and rate of turn desired.
      double getWheelDistance()
      This method returns the distance between two wheels in a differential drive system.
      void setWheelDistance(double aWheelDistance)
      This method adjusts the distance between the two wheels of a differential drive system.
      double speedDifferenceForTurnRate(double aTurnRate)
      This method returns the difference in wheel speeds required in order to achieve a particular turn rate.
      double turnRateForSpeed(double aWheelSpeed)
      This method helps to calculate the speed turn rate which would result from each wheel moving at the given speed in opposite directions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Model

        public Model(double aWheelDistance)
        This instantiates the simple differential drive model with the distance between the two wheels given in meters.
        Parameters:
        aWheelDistance - The distance between the center-point of the wheels. The model assumes that the wheels rotate along the same axis independently of each other.

    • Method Detail

      • setWheelDistance

        public void setWheelDistance(double aWheelDistance)
        This method adjusts the distance between the two wheels of a differential drive system.
        Parameters:
        aWheelDistance - The distance between wheels (in meters) of the differential drive system.

      • getWheelDistance

        public double getWheelDistance()
        This method returns the distance between two wheels in a differential drive system.
        Returns:
        The distance between wheels (in meters) of the differential drive system.

      • calculateBearing

        public Model.SpeedAndTurnRate calculateBearing(Model.WheelVelocities aWheelVelocities)
        This method calculates the speed and turn rate from the given wheel velocities.
        Parameters:
        aWheelVelocities - The velocities of the two wheels of the differential drive.
        Returns:
        The speed and rate of turn for the assembly.

      • calculateBearing

        public Model.SpeedAndTurnRate calculateBearing(double aLeftVelocity,
                                      double aRightVelocity)
        This method calculates the speed and turn rate from the given wheel velocities.
        Parameters:
        aLeftVelocity - The left wheel velocity.
        aRightVelocity - The right wheel velocity.
        Returns:
        The speed and rate of turn for the assembly.

      • speedDifferenceForTurnRate

        public double speedDifferenceForTurnRate(double aTurnRate)
        This method returns the difference in wheel speeds required in order to achieve a particular turn rate.
        Parameters:
        aTurnRate - The turn rate (radians/sec) required.
        Returns:
        The difference in wheel speeds required in order to achieve the turn rate.

      • turnRateForSpeed

        public double turnRateForSpeed(double aWheelSpeed)
        This method helps to calculate the speed turn rate which would result from each wheel moving at the given speed in opposite directions.
        Parameters:
        aWheelSpeed - Rate at which each wheel is moving in opposite directions (m/s)
        Returns:
        The number of radians per second that the object will turn.

      • calculateWheelVelocities

        public Model.WheelVelocities calculateWheelVelocities(double aVelocity,
                                             double aRadiansPerSecond)
        This method calculates the speed of each of the wheels given the total velocity and rate of turn desired.
        Parameters:
        aVelocity - The desired total velocity.
        aRadiansPerSecond - The desired rate of turn.
        Returns:
        The left and right wheel velocities to achieve this state.
